metadata.author: Microsoft - support@microsoft.com
metadata.comments: Solution template for McAfee Network Security Platform

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

variables.parserName1: McAfee Network Security Platform Data Parser

properties.description: McAfee Network Security Platform data connector with template
McAfee Network Security Platform data connector with template version 2.0.1

connectorUiConfig.title: McAfee Network Security Platform
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [McAfee® Network Security Platform](https://www.mcafee.com/enterprise/en-us/products/network-security-platform.html) data connector provides the capability to ingest [McAfee® Network Security Platform events](https://docs.mcafee.com/bundle/network-security-platform-10.1.x-integration-guide-unmanaged/page/GUID-8C706BE9-6AC9-4641-8A53-8910B51207D8.html) into Microsoft Sentinel. Refer to [McAfee® Network Security Platform](https://docs.mcafee.com/bundle/network-security-platform-10.1.x-integration-guide-unmanaged/page/GUID-F7D281EC-1CC9-4962-A7A3-5A9D9584670E.html) for more information.
connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**McAfeeNSPEvent**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-mcafeensp-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

sampleQueries.query:
McAfeeNSPEvent
 | summarize count() by tostring(DvcHostname)
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: Syslog (McAfeeNSPEvent)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
McAfeeNSPEvent
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
McAfeeNSPEvent
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**McAfeeNSPEvent**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-mcafeensp-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.
>**NOTE:** This data connector has been developed using McAfee® Network Security Platform version: 10.1.x

Install the agent on the Server where the McAfee® Network Security Platform logs are forwarded.

> Logs from McAfee® Network Security Platform Server deployed on Linux or Windows servers are collected by **Linux** or **Windows** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the Linux agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux or Windows

parameters.title: Choose where to install the Windows agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Windows Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Windows Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

Follow the configuration steps below to get McAfee® Network Security Platform logs into Microsoft Sentinel.
1. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.mcafee.com/bundle/network-security-platform-10.1.x-product-guide/page/GUID-E4A687B0-FAFB-4170-AC94-1D968A10380F.html) to forward alerts from the Manager to a syslog server.
2. Add a syslog notification profile, [more details here](https://docs.mcafee.com/bundle/network-security-platform-10.1.x-product-guide/page/GUID-5BADD5D7-21AE-4E3B-AEE2-A079F3FD6A38.html). This is mandatory. While creating profile, to make sure that events are formatted correctly, enter the following text in the Message text box:
		<SyslogAlertForwarderNSP>:|SENSOR_ALERT_UUID|ALERT_TYPE|ATTACK_TIME|ATTACK_NAME|ATTACK_ID
		|ATTACK_SEVERITY|ATTACK_SIGNATURE|ATTACK_CONFIDENCE|ADMIN_DOMAIN|SENSOR_NAME|INTERFACE
		|SOURCE_IP|SOURCE_PORT|DESTINATION_IP|DESTINATION_PORT|CATEGORY|SUB_CATEGORY
		|DIRECTION|RESULT_STATUS|DETECTION_MECHANISM|APPLICATION_PROTOCOL|NETWORK_PROTOCOL|
instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure McAfee® Network Security Platform event forwarding

Refer to [McAfee® Network Security Platform](https://docs.mcafee.com/bundle/network-security-platform-10.1.x-integration-guide-unmanaged/page/GUID-F7D281EC-1CC9-4962-A7A3-5A9D9584670E.html) for more information.

            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

 | summarize count() by tostring(DvcHostname)
 | top 10 by count_

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**McAfeeNSPEvent**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-mcafeensp-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.
>**NOTE:** This data connector has been developed using McAfee® Network Security Platform version: 10.1.x

Install the agent on the Server where the McAfee® Network Security Platform logs are forwarded.

> Logs from McAfee® Network Security Platform Server deployed on Linux or Windows servers are collected by **Linux** or **Windows** agents.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Windows Virtual Machine

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Windows Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

Follow the configuration steps below to get McAfee® Network Security Platform logs into Microsoft Sentinel.
1. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.mcafee.com/bundle/network-security-platform-10.1.x-product-guide/page/GUID-E4A687B0-FAFB-4170-AC94-1D968A10380F.html) to forward alerts from the Manager to a syslog server.
2. Add a syslog notification profile, [more details here](https://docs.mcafee.com/bundle/network-security-platform-10.1.x-product-guide/page/GUID-5BADD5D7-21AE-4E3B-AEE2-A079F3FD6A38.html). This is mandatory. While creating profile, to make sure that events are formatted correctly, enter the following text in the Message text box:
		<SyslogAlertForwarderNSP>:|SENSOR_ALERT_UUID|ALERT_TYPE|ATTACK_TIME|ATTACK_NAME|ATTACK_ID
		|ATTACK_SEVERITY|ATTACK_SIGNATURE|ATTACK_CONFIDENCE|ADMIN_DOMAIN|SENSOR_NAME|INTERFACE
		|SOURCE_IP|SOURCE_PORT|DESTINATION_IP|DESTINATION_PORT|CATEGORY|SUB_CATEGORY
		|DIRECTION|RESULT_STATUS|DETECTION_MECHANISM|APPLICATION_PROTOCOL|NETWORK_PROTOCOL|
instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure McAfee® Network Security Platform event forwarding

connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**McAfeeNSPEvent**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-mcafeensp-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

properties.description: McAfeeNSPEvent Data Parser with template version 2.0.1

properties.displayName: McAfee Network Security Platform Data Parser
properties.query:
Syslog
| where ProcessName == "SyslogAlertForwarderNSP"
| extend EventVendor = 'McAfee'
| extend EventProduct = 'Network Security Manager'
| extend EventData = split(SyslogMessage, "|") 
| extend EventOriginalUid = EventData[1]
| extend EventType = EventData[2]
| extend EventEndTime = EventData[3]
| extend ThreatName = EventData[4]
| extend ThreatId = EventData[5]
| extend EventSeverity = EventData[6]
| extend SignatureId = EventData[7]
| extend AlertConfidence = EventData[8]
| extend DvcDomain = EventData[9]
| extend DvcHostname = EventData[10]
| extend DvcInboundInterface = EventData[11]
| extend SrcIpAddr = EventData[12]
| extend SrcPortNumber = EventData[13]
| extend DstIpAddr = EventData[14]
| extend DstPortNumber = EventData[15]
| extend EventSubType = EventData[16]
| extend Application = EventData[17]
| extend NetworkDirection = EventData[18]
| extend DvcAction = EventData[19]
| extend DetectionMechanism = EventData[20]
| extend ApplicationProtocol = EventData[21]
| extend NetworkProtocol = EventData[22]
